TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PublishingService extends System.Web.Services.WebService
Public NotInheritable Class PublishingService Inherits WebService
public ref class PublishingService sealed : System::Web::Services::WebService

Docs.summary: The SOAP interface for the Publishing Web Service.

remarks.para: The Publishing Service is responsible for creating objects, disconnecting PageLayout objects from objects, and reconnecting those PageLayout objects to the PublishingPage objects to which they were connected.
Additionally, you can use this class to export or import PublishingPage objects between source and target objects, get status of a publishing object or collection of publishing objects, and more.

Public Function CreatePageLayout (pageLayoutName As String, associatedContentTypeId As String, title As String, description As String, siteUrl As String) As String

member this.CreatePageLayout : string * string * string * string * string -> string

Docs.param: File name of the new page layout. It must have an .aspx extension. It should not include the path to the file.
Associated content type ID string.
Optional string value specifying the title of the page layout. This parameter may be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Optional string value specifying the description of the page layout. This parameter may be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Absolute URL of the site. The page layout is created in the page layout gallery on the root Web of the specified site.
Docs.returns: A string containing the absolute URL of the new PageLayout object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DisconnectPageLayout (string pageUrl);
.method public hidebysig instance void DisconnectPageLayout(string pageUrl) cil managed
Public Sub DisconnectPageLayout (pageUrl As String)
public: void DisconnectPageLayout(System::String ^ pageUrl);
member this.DisconnectPageLayout : string -> unit

Docs.param: Server-relative URL of the page to be disconnected.
Docs.summary: Disconnect a object from its to make its markup a copy of the page layout's markup.

remarks.para: When a user navigates to a PublishingPage, the contents of its PageLayout object are used to render the page. Using the contents of the page layout allows page designers to change the markup of a single page layout and affect the display of every page that uses that page layout.

However, there are times when a Web designer needs to create a particular type of page and none of the available page layouts are appropriate. In this scenario, you can disconnect the page from its page layout. The DisconnectPageLayout(System.String) method places a copy of the page layout's markup in the markup of the PublishingPage. The Web designer can then make changes to the markup in the page without affecting any other pages of the same type. You must have the permission to call this method.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebServices.FriendlyUrl[] GetAllFriendlyUrls (Guid siteId, Guid webId, ref string pagingToken);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebServices.FriendlyUrl[] GetAllFriendlyUrls(valuetype System.Guid siteId, valuetype System.Guid webId, string& pagingToken) cil managed
Public Function GetAllFriendlyUrls (siteId As Guid, webId As Guid, ByRef pagingToken As String) As FriendlyUrl()
public: cli::array <Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebServices::FriendlyUrl ^> ^ GetAllFriendlyUrls(Guid siteId, Guid webId, System::String ^ % pagingToken);
member this.GetAllFriendlyUrls : Guid * Guid * -> Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebServices.FriendlyUrl[]

Docs.param: ID of the object.
ID of the SPWeb object.

There may be a large number of results that need to be returned. In that case, the results need to be chunked into pages. The parameter is an opaque token that SharePoint Server returns to the caller of the web service. The caller keeps calling the GetFriendlyUrlBasedWebs(System.Guid,System.String@) method with the parameter, and SharePoint Server continues to update the paging token until the last page is reached. When the last page is reached, SharePoint Server sets it to an empty string. In the first call, the caller is supposed to set the parameter to an empty string.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of objects —one for each friendly URL and its associated properties in the specified .

remarks.para: The call is paged by using the page token so that in any given call SharePoint Server return only one page (= PageSize) number of entries. If there are more, then the subsequent calls will have to be made by using this method with a new .

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebServices.FriendlyUrlBasedWeb[] GetChangedFriendlyUrlBasedWebs(valuetype System.Guid contentPartitionId, string changeToken, string& pagingToken) cil managed
Public Function GetChangedFriendlyUrlBasedWebs (contentPartitionId As Guid, changeToken As String, ByRef pagingToken As String) As FriendlyUrlBasedWeb()

public: cli::array <Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::WebServices::FriendlyUrlBasedWeb ^> ^ GetChangedFriendlyUrlBasedWebs(Guid contentPartitionId, System::String ^ changeToken, System::String ^ % pagingToken);
member this.GetChangedFriendlyUrlBasedWebs : Guid * string * -> Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebServices.FriendlyUrlBasedWeb[]

Docs.param: To be added.
An opaque token passed to the caller when the call to GetAllContentPartitions is made. The caller is supposed to pass that token to get a list of objects that changed since the token was issued.
Tracks the current page of result.
Docs.summary: Returns the list of webs that have changed after the last “changeToken”.

remarks.para: There may be a large number of results that need to be returned. In that case, the results need to be chunked into pages. The parameter is an opaque token that SharePoint Server returns to the caller of the web service. The caller keeps calling the GetFriendlyUrlBasedWebs(System.Guid,System.String@) method with the parameter, and SharePoint Server continues to update the paging token until the last page is reached. When the last page is reached, SharePoint Server sets it to an empty string. In the first call, the caller is supposed to set the parameter to an empty string.
The returned results are based on the following:

item.description: If any web is deleted from the content database, SharePoint Server returns it.
Any web that has started or stopped using managed navigation is returned.

If there is any change in a NavigationTermSet object, then all of the webs that are associated with the NavigationTermSet are returned. If the pass is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), it behaves exactly the same as the GetAllWebs method.

The parameter is an opaque token that SharePoint Server returns to the caller of the web service. The caller keeps calling the GetFriendlyUrlBasedWebs(System.Guid,System.String@) method with the parameter, and SharePoint Server continues to update the paging token until the last page is reached. When the last page is reached, SharePoint Server sets it to an empty string. In the first call, the caller is supposed to set the parameter to an empty string.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of the friendly URLs for the specified parameter, and parameter values that have changed since the last search crawl.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ReconnectPageLayout (string pageUrl);
.method public hidebysig instance string ReconnectPageLayout(string pageUrl) cil managed
Public Function ReconnectPageLayout (pageUrl As String) As String
public: System::String ^ ReconnectPageLayout(System::String ^ pageUrl);
member this.ReconnectPageLayout : string -> string

Docs.param: Server-relative URL of the PublishingPage to be reconnected.
Docs.summary: Use this method to reconnect a object to its object and replace its custom markup with default PublishingPage markup.
Docs.returns: A of the form .A ReturnCode of 1 means that the PublishingPage is reconnected to the same PageLayout object specified in URL from which it was originally disconnected.A ReturnCode of 2 means that the PublishingPage was not reconnected to the same PageLayout object specified in URL from which it was originally disconnected. Instead, it was reconnected to one of the available PageLayout objects for the content type of this PublishingPage.

remarks.para: This method first attempts to reconnect the page to the same page layout that was previously used. However, if that page layout no longer exists because it was renamed or deleted, the method uses the content type of the page to find the first PageLayout object it can find for that content type. The PublishingPage object then reconnects to that PageLayout object.
You must have the permission to call this method.
